00026 typedef enum
00027 {
00028   MAC_PHY_HWD_TASK_ID = 1 << 0,
00029   HAL_TASK_ID         = 1 << 1,
00030   MAC_HWI_TASK_ID     = 1 << 2,
00031   NWK_TASK_ID         = 1 << 3,
00032   ZDO_TASK_ID         = 1 << 4,
00033   APS_TASK_ID         = 1 << 5,
00034   SSP_TASK_ID         = 1 << 6,

00036   BSP_TASK_ID         = 1 << 8,
00037   APL_TASK_ID         = 1 << 9,
00038   ZSE_TASK_ID         = 1 << 0xA,
00039 } SYS_TaskId_t;

00046 extern void APL_TaskHandler(void);

00069 extern volatile uint16_t SYS_taskFlag;
00070 // \endcond
00071 
00072 /**************************************************************************************/
00077 /*
00078 IDs of the tasks are listed in the SYS_TaskId enum. Each task has its own priority and is called
00079 only if there is no any task with higher priority. A handler is called when respective task can be run.
00080 Each task has its own task handler. Correspondence between tasks and handlers is listed below:  \n
00081 HAL - HAL_TaskHandler()                 \n
00082 BSP - BSP_TaskHandler()                 \n
00083 MAC_PHY_HWD - MAC_PHY_HWD_TaskHandler() \n
00084 MAC_HWI - MAC_HWI_TaskHandler()         \n
00085 NWK - NWK_TaskHandler()                 \n
00086 ZDO - ZDO_TaskHandler()                 \n
00087 APS - APS_TaskHandler()                 \n
00088 APL - APL_TaskHandler()                 \n
00089 */
00090 INLINE void SYS_PostTask(SYS_TaskId_t taskId)
00091 {
00092   ATOMIC_SECTION_ENTER
00093    SYS_taskFlag |= taskId;
00094   ATOMIC_SECTION_LEAVE
00095 }
00096 
00097 //\cond internal
00098 /**************************************************************************************/
00101 bool SYS_RunTask(void);
00102 
00103 /**************************************************************************************//*
00104  \brief To force runTask to help making sync calls
00105 ******************************************************************************************/
00106 void SYS_ForceRunTask(void);
00107 // \endcond
00108 
00109 #endif
